schedule1.text: Is the solution provided both correct and includes a convincing short argument justifying it?

schedule2.text: Is the solution provided both correct and includes a convincing short argument justifying it?

scenario1.text: Is the solution provided both correct and includes a convincing short argument justifying it?
scenario1.comment: But T_3 is rolled back, not aborted

scenario2.text: Is the solution provided both correct and includes a convincing short argument justifying it?

scenario3.text: Is the solution provided both correct and includes a convincing short argument justifying it?

q1a.text: Does the solution contain a clear description of the approach used to achieve before-or-after atomicity?

q1b.text: Provide comments on any aspects that you found unclear in the description of the approach to achieve before-or-after atomicity

q1c.text: Does the code include implementations of Tests 1 and 2 of the assignment description as well as of at least another two test cases?

q1d-i.text: Is it tested that the final state resulting from concurrent execution is correct in that it respects invariants designed in the test?

q1d-ii.text: Is it tested that intermediate reads of the state during concurrent execution respect invariants designed in the test, so that it is arguable that these intermediate states could be found in an equivalent serial schedule?

q1e.text: Provide comments on why you found that any portions of the test descriptions were unclear according to the criteria, and suggestions for improvement
q1e.answer: When describing each test it would could have been good with the name of the test method, which would have made it easier to locate the different tests in the code. In the description of test 4 (test of many clients) it is not mentioned how many clients are used(200,000 but only 1000 are running at a time). With the manual locks, it shouldn't be necessary to use a concurrent hash map.

q2a.text: Is the variant of 2PL to which equivalence is being established in the correctness argument clearly identified (e.g., conservative, strict, conservative strict)?

q2b.text: Is there a sound argumentation of why the steps in the locking protocol designed correspond to steps taken in the chosen variant of 2PL?

q2c.text: Is there an argument for the need to take into account predicate reads, with appropriate justification?

q2d.text: Is there an argument for the need to take into account predicate reads, with appropriate justification?
q2d.answer: The argument part is lacking. It is more a description of how they implemented the locking protocol, but an actual argument for why this protocol is correct is thin.

q3a.text: Does the solution contain a correct argument for why deadlocks can occur in the locking protocol or why deadlocks cannot occur?

q3b.text: Provide comments on how the argument provided with respect to deadlocks could be improved
q3b.answer: Explain why conservative twi phase locking can not lead to deadlocks.

q4a.text: Is there a sound argument about the scalability limits of the concurrent implementation provided?

q4b.text: Provide comments on how the reflections on scalability could be improved

question5.title: Argumentation on decisions made for performance

q5a.text: Is there a sound argument in the solution about the trade-off between locking overhead and concurrency?

q5b.text: Provide comments on how the argument about performance trade-offs in the locking protocol could be improved
